intro: Clerodendrum katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of red and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in suitable regions.
